body: So that's an issue for numeric keys only. For string keys it works as expected...
The fix, indeed, works and doesn't seem to break any tests. Also, looks OK to me.
@yiisoft/reviewers any implications about the change that I can't see?

issue.title: Fix #18046: Fix `\yii\helpers\ArrayHelper::merge()` for numeric keys

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Tests pass?   | ✔️
| Fixed issues  | #18046

body:
I'd expect the expected result in the OP only for a string `"10"` not necessarily for an 
*integer* value of `10`, which is "just" the 10th position in an array in PHP.

I am not saying one way is fully correct or the other, but I won't change that for Yii2, there might be code which is relying on this behavior.

Although this could be done with an additional method `merge...()` to maintain BC.

> I'd expect the expected result in the OP only for a string `"10"` not necessarily for an
> _integer_ value of `10`,

There is no difference between integer and integer-as-string in case of array keys: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/5081#issuecomment-55915761
Alright. @iz65535 seems changing this behavior would break things so we can't fix it. Need to add a test for current behavior.
